intro: Talauma sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak talauma, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
